channel.title: math.SP updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.SP updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Maximally dissipative and self-adjoint extensions of $K$-invariant operators
item.description: arXiv:2509.05178v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We introduce the notion of $K$-invariant operators, $S$, (in a Hilbert space) with respect to a bounded and boundedly invertible operator $K$ defined via $K^*SK=S$. Conditions such that self-adjoint and maximally dissipative extensions of $K$-invariant symmetric operators are also $K$-invariant are investigated. In particular, the Friedrichs and Krein--von Neumann extensions of a nonnegative $K$-invariant symmetric operator are shown to always be $K$-invariant, while the Friedrichs extension of a $K$-invariant sectorial operator is as well. We apply our results to the case of Sturm--Liouville operators where $K$ is given by $(Kf)(x)=A(x)f(\phi(x))$ under appropriate assumptions. Sufficient conditions on the coefficient functions for $K$-invariance to hold are shown to be related to Schr\"oder's equation and all $K$-invariant self-adjoint extensions are characterized. Explicit examples are discussed including a Bessel-type Schr\"odinger operator satisfying a nontrivial $K$-invariance on the half-line.
item.dc:creator: Christoph Fischbacher, Bart Rosenzweig, Jonathan Stanfill

item.title: A Gutzwiller trace formula for singular potentials
item.description: arXiv:2509.05220v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: The Gutzwiller trace formula relates the asymptotic spacing of quantum-mechanical energy levels in the semiclassical limit to the dynamics of periodic classical particle trajectories. We generalize this result to the case of non-smooth potentials, for which there is partial reflection of energy from derivative discontinuities of the potential. It is the periodic trajectories of an associated branching dynamics that contribute to the trace asymptotics in this more general setting; we obtain a precise description of their contribution.
item.dc:creator: Jared Wunsch, Mengxuan Yang, Yuzhou Joey Zou

item.title: Pascal's Matrix, Point Counting on Elliptic Curves and Prolate Spheroidal Functions
item.description: arXiv:2508.08494v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: The eigenvectors of the $(N+1)\times (N+1)$ symmetric Pascal matrix $T_N$ are analogs of prolate spheroidal wave functions in the discrete setting. The generating functions of the eigenvectors of $T_N$ are prolate spheroidal functions in the sense that they are simultaneously eigenfunctions of a third-order differential operator and an integral operator over the critical line $\{z\in\mathbb{C}: \text{Re}(z) = 1/2\}$. For even, positive integers $N$, we obtain an explicit formula for the generating function of an eigenvector of the symmetric pascal matrix with eigenvalue $1$. In the special case when $N=p-1$ for an odd prime $p$, we show that the generating function is equivalent modulo $p$ to $(\# E_z(\mathbb F_p)-1)^2$, where $\# E_z(\mathbb F_p)$ is the number of points on the Legendre elliptic curve $y^2 = x(x-1)(x-z)$ over the finite field $\mathbb F_p$.
item.dc:creator: W. Riley Casper
